snippet: The company blamed the declining personal computer market and disappointing sales of its Surface RT tablet for missing Wall Street’s quarterly forecasts.
abstract: Microsoft misses Wall Street second-quarter forecasts, blaming declining personal computer market and disappointing sales of its Surface RT tablet; profit was $4.97 billion, or 59 cents a share, compared with loss of $492 million, or 6 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 10 percent to $19.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: The company blamed the declining personal computer market and disappointing sales of its Surface RT tablet for missing Wall Street’s quarterly forecasts.

headline.main: Weak PC Market Catches Up to Microsoft
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Shares Drop After It Disappoints on Profit and Sales
